title: Arrondissement of Clermont-Ferrand
text:
The arrondissement of Clermont-Ferrand is an <a href="Arrondissements%20of%20France">arrondissement</a> of <a href="France">France</a> in the <a href="Puy-de-D%C3%B4me">Puy-de-Dôme</a> <a href="Departments%20of%20France">department</a> in the <a href="Auvergne-Rh%C3%B4ne-Alpes">Auvergne-Rhône-Alpes</a> <a href="Regions%20of%20France">region</a>. It has 74 <a href="Communes%20of%20France">communes</a>. Its population is 354,048 (2016), and its area is .
Composition.
The communes of the arrondissement of Clermont-Ferrand, and their <a href="INSEE%20code">INSEE code</a>s, are:
History.
The arrondissement of Clermont-Ferrand was created in 1800. At the January 2017 reorganisation of the arrondissements of Puy-de-Dôme, it gained one commune from the <a href="arrondissement%20of%20Riom">arrondissement of Riom</a>, and it lost three communes to the <a href="arrondissement%20of%20Ambert">arrondissement of Ambert</a>, 21 communes to the <a href="arrondissement%20of%20Issoire">arrondissement of Issoire</a>, 17 communes to the arrondissement of Riom and four communes to the <a href="arrondissement%20of%20Thiers">arrondissement of Thiers</a>.
As a result of the reorganisation of the <a href="cantons%20of%20France">cantons of France</a> which came into effect in 2015, the borders of the cantons are no longer related to the borders of the arrondissements. The cantons of the arrondissement of Clermont-Ferrand were, as of January 2015:
